article_title: Education Via the Five-Foot Shelf — Letters to the Editor
article_text:
In regard to Paula Marantz Cohen’s review of the Harvard Classics (“A Year of 15-Minute Daily Doses From the Harvard Classics,” op-ed, Dec. 27): I too was captivated by the series’ ambitious promises. For the past four years, I have been reading my way through the five-foot shelf of books and now find myself in Volume 46 of 50, Elizabethan Drama.

Through a half-hour, or about 20 pages of reading, each day, I have read works ranging from the letters of Pliny to the poetry of Whitman to the science of Darwin. With this...

twitter.description: these books have given me both thorough academic preparation for my time at Harvard and the discerning perspective for life all liberal educations promise.
twitter.title: Education Via the Five-Foot Shelf

article_summary:
In regard to Paula Marantz Cohen’s review of the Harvard Classics (“A Year of 15-Minute Daily Doses From the Harvard Classics,” op-ed, Dec. 27): I too was captivated by the series’ ambitious promises.
For the past four years, I have been reading my way through the five-foot shelf of books and now find myself in Volume 46 of 50, Elizabethan Drama.
Through a half-hour, or about 20 pages of reading, each day, I have read works ranging from the letters of Pliny to the poetry of Whitman to the science of Darwin.
With this...
